Based on your preferences, I would recommend watching "Red Cliff" (1998). This historical war movie features stunning visuals and a captivating storyline that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Additionally, if you enjoy intense action scenes, then "Saving Private Ryan" (1998) is another great option. This modern war movie follows a US Navy SEAL team as they go behind enemy lines to rescue a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

Finally, if you're looking for an epic historical adventure, then "Gladiator" (2000) is the perfect choice. This historical war movie features stunning visuals and a captivating storyline that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

I hope these recommendations help you find the perfect movie to watch!

conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Hotel Rwanda" as a potential recommendation. This movie tells the story of Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager who shelters over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa. The movie was directed by Roland Kuhn and is based on his novel "Hotel Rwanda: The Genocide Story." The movie stars Naveen Andrews as Paul Rusesabagina, Juliette Binoche as Tintina Haringurana, Ralph Fiennes as Colonel Jean de Brissac, Don Cheadle as General Dikotare, and Willem Dafoe as General León Maldonado.
